title: Walgreens won't sell abortion pills in red states that threatened legal action
description: The 20 states where Walgreens won't sell mifepristone include some where abortion remains legal. It's not clear whether other retail pharmacies will follow suit.

title: How this year's Selma Bridge Crossing could mark a community renaissance
description: President Biden visits Selma for the 58th anniversary of "Bloody Sunday." Residents there are still recovering from tornadoes that ripped through the city in January.

title: A Philippine governor and 5 other people are killed in a brazen attack
description: Gunmen in military uniforms fatally shot Negros Oriental Gov. Roel Degamo and five civilians while the provincial leader was meeting villagers at his home in the central Philippines.

title: Storms across the U.S. cause deaths and power outages
description: Large swaths of the U.S. have faced an intense winter storm over the past several days. More than a million customers were without power and weather advisories were issued across the country.

title: Russia's foreign minister gets laughed at over Ukraine remarks at a global conference
description: Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said Russia was not the aggressor in the Ukraine war, but that his country was simply trying to defend itself, to which the crowd laughed and groaned.

title: Photos show double blow of war and earthquakes in regime-held Syria
description: NPR gained rare access to parts of Syria after last month's devastating earthquakes, photographing what life is like for people who were already coping with a years-long civil war.

title: Hong Kong court convicts 3 activists who organized Tiananmen vigils
description: Three Hong Kong activists have been convicted after they refused to provide information to authorities required by national security policy.

title: Over $30M worth of Funkos are being dumped
description: Funko, the maker of the Funko Pop! collectible figurines, will "eliminate" a massive batch of its inventory to alleviate some of the company's financial struggles.

title: Students learn lessons on climate change, pollution through raising salmon
description: Although many Alaskan students are familiar with salmon fishing, raising them gives them a new perspective on writing, science, math and art.

title: An American walked her pet cow in Moscow's Red Square. Spoiler alert: Trouble ensued
description: Animal rights activist Alicia Day says she routinely walks her farm animals in public to encourage people to think twice about eating meat. Why she chose to do so in the center of Moscow isn't clear.

title: Biden and House Democrats chart a 2024 course based on their legislative track record
description: Democrats are strategizing on how to win back the House next year and are undertaking a publicity blitz to remind voters of their records.

title: Big stores see how we spend. Here are 4 things they say about the economy
description: Retailers have dropped a flurry of financial reports. They paint a messy and conflicting picture about our consumer economy.

title: Ukraine is dominating the election in Estonia, a key NATO ally. Here's what to watch
description: Prime Minister Kaja Kallas has led the former Soviet republic since 2021. She's an outspoken critic of Russian President Vladimir Putin, and a vocal supporter of Ukraine.

title: Astronomers still have their eyes on that asteroid NASA whacked
description: NASA's Double Asteroid Redirection Test slammed a spacecraft into an asteroid, directly altering its path through space. Scientists are still studying the space rock to learn more.

title: Some California mountain residents could be snowed in for another week
description: A late-February blast of arctic air produced a rare blizzard east of Los Angeles in the San Bernardino Mountains, where thousands of people live in forest communities or visit for recreation.

title: Tom Sizemore, 'Saving Private Ryan' actor, has died at 61
description: Before addiction consumed Tim Sizemore's career, he was a go-to character actor known for portraying tough guys in movies such as "Heat" and "Saving Private Ryan."
